text:
The arrondissement of Narbonne is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Aude "département" in the Occitanie region. Its capital, and subprefecture of the department, is the city of Narbonne.
History.
When the Aude department was created on 17 February 1800, the "arrondissement" of Narbonne was part of that original department.
Geography.
It is the easternmost and second largest of the "arrondissements" of the department, with an area of, with a population of 159,569 inhabitants and a density of inhabitants/km².
The "arrondissement" of Narbonne is bordered to the north by the Hérault department, to the east by the Mediterranean Sea, to the south by the Pyrénées-Orientales department and to the west by the "arrondissement" of Carcassonne.
Cantons.
After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the "arrondissements" so they could have "communes" that belong to different "arrondissements".
